member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAntialiasing
member.summary: Specifies the antialiasing mode for non-text primitives.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAntialiasing.Antialiased
member.summary: Edges are antialiased using a high quality per-primitive method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAntialiasing.Aliased
member.summary: Edges are aliased.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend
member.summary: Specifies the blend mode used to draw primitives.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend.SourceOver
member.summary: The standard source-over-destination blend mode, also known as premultiplied alpha blending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend.Copy
member.summary: The source is copied to the destination; destination pixels are ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend.Min
member.summary: Use the minimum of the source and destination pixel values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend.Add
member.summary: Take the sum of the source and destination pixel values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasCapStyle
member.summary: Describes the shape at the end of a line or segment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasCapStyle.Flat
member.summary: A cap that does not extend past the last point of the line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasCapStyle.Square
member.summary: Half of a square that has a length equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasCapStyle.Round
member.summary: A semicircle that has a diameter equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasCapStyle.Triangle
member.summary: An isosceles right triangle whose hypotenuse is equal in length to the thickness of the line.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDashStyle
member.summary: Describes the sequence of dashes, dots, and gaps in a stroke style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDashStyle.Solid
member.summary: A solid line with no breaks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDashStyle.Dash
member.summary: A dash followed by a gap of equal length. The dash and the gap are each twice as long as the stroke thickness. The equivalent custom dash style is { 2, 2 }.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDashStyle.Dot
member.summary: A dot followed by a longer gap. The equivalent custom dash style is { 0, 2 }.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDashStyle.DashDot
member.summary: A dash, followed by a gap, followed by a dot, followed by another gap. The equivalent custom dash style is { 2, 2, 0, 2 }.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDashStyle.DashDotDot
member.summary: A dash, followed by a gap, followed by a dot, followed by another gap, followed by another dot, followed by another gap. The equivalent custom dash style is { 2, 2, 0, 2, 0, 2 }.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel
member.summary: Indicates the type of information provided when the Direct2D Debug Layer is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel.None
member.summary: No debugging output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel.Error
member.summary: Only error messages are output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel.Warning
member.summary: Error messages and warnings are output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel.Information
member.summary: Error messages, warnings, and additional diagnostic information that can help improve performance are output.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLineJoin
member.summary: Describes the shape that joins two lines or segments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Regular angular vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Beveled vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Rounded vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLineJoin.MiterOrBevel
member.summary: Regular angular vertices unless the join would extend beyond the miter limit; otherwise, beveled vertices.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasStrokeTransformBehavior
member.summary: Defines how the world transform, dots per inch (DPI), and stroke width affect the shape of the pen used to stroke a primitive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasStrokeTransformBehavior.Normal
member.summary: The stroke respects the currently set world transform, the DPI, and the stroke width.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasStrokeTransformBehavior.Fixed
member.summary: The stroke does not respect the world transform but it does respect the DPI and stroke width.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasStrokeTransformBehavior.Hairline
member.summary: The stroke is forced to 1 pixel wide (in device space) and does not respect the world transform, the DPI, or the stroke width.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasTextAntialiasing
member.summary: Specifies the antialiasing mode for drawing text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasTextAntialiasing.Default
member.summary: Use the system default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasTextAntialiasing.ClearType
member.summary: Use ClearType antialiasing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasTextAntialiasing.Grayscale
member.summary: Use grayscale antialiasing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasTextAntialiasing.Aliased
member.summary: Do not use antialiasing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasUnits
member.summary: Specifies what units coordinates are in. This is important for making sure everything stays in the right place when running on high DPI devices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasUnits.Dips
member.summary: Units are interpreted as device-independent pixels. This matches the behavior of the XAML UI framework.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasUnits.Pixels
member.summary: Units are interpreted as pixels. This matches the Direct3D graphics API.

member.summary: No trimming occurs. Text flows beyond the layout width.

member.summary: Words are broken across lines to avoid text overflowing the layout box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasWordWrapping.NoWrap
member.summary: Words are kept within the same line even when it overflows the layout box. This option is often used with scrolling to reveal overflow text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasWordWrapping.EmergencyBreak
member.summary: Words are broken across lines to avoid text overflowing the layout box. Emergency wrapping occurs if the word is larger than the maximum width.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasWordWrapping.WholeWord
member.summary: When emergency wrapping, only wrap whole words, never breaking words when the layout width is too small for even a single word.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasWordWrapping.Character
member.summary: Wrap between any valid character clusters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.D32FloatS8X24UInt
member.summary: A 32-bit floating-point component, and two unsigned-integer components (with an additional 32 bits). This format supports 32-bit depth, 8-bit stencil, and 24 bits are unused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.R32FloatX8X24Typeless
member.summary: A 32-bit floating-point component, and two typeless components (with an additional 32 bits). This format supports 32-bit red channel, 8 bits are unused, and 24 bits are unused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.X32TypelessG8X24UInt
member.summary: A 32-bit typeless component, and two unsigned-integer components (with an additional 32 bits). This format has 32 bits unused, 8 bits for green channel, and 24 bits are unused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.R10G10B10A2Typeless
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit typeless format that supports 10 bits for each color and 2 bits for alpha.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.R10G10B10A2UIntNormalized

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.R10G10B10A2UInt
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-integer format that supports 10 bits for each color and 2 bits for alpha.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.R11G11B10Float
member.summary: Three partial-precision floating-point numbers encoded into a single 32-bit value (a variant of s10e5, which is sign bit, 10-bit mantissa, and 5-bit biased (15) exponent). There are no sign bits, and there is a 5-bit biased (15) exponent for each channel, 6-bit mantissa for R and G, and a 5-bit mantissa for B.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.R9G9B9E5SharedExponent
member.summary: Three partial-precision floating-point numbers encoded into a single 32-bit value all sharing the same 5-bit exponent (variant of s10e5, which is sign bit, 10-bit mantissa, and 5-bit biased (15) exponent). There is no sign bit, and there is a shared 5-bit biased (15) exponent and a 9-bit mantissa for each channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.R8G8B8G8UIntNormalized
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format. This packed RGB format is analogous to the UYVY format. Each 32-bit block describes a pair of pixels: (R8, G8, B8) and (R8, G8, B8) where the R8/B8 values are repeated, and the G8 values are unique to each pixel. Width must be even.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.DirectX.DirectXPixelFormat.G8R8G8B8UIntNormalized
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format. This packed RGB format is analogous to the YUY2 format. Each 32-bit block describes a pair of pixels: (R8, G8, B8) and (R8, G8, B8) where the R8/B8 values are repeated, and the G8 values are unique to each pixel. Width must be even.
